member.name: IWeakReference.Resolve
member.summary: Resolves a weak reference by returning a strong reference to the object.
member.param: A reference to the interface identifier (IID) of the object.
A strong reference to the object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IWeakReference.Resolve
member.summary: Resolves a weak reference by returning a strong reference to the implementing object.
member.param: A strong reference to the object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Represents a weak reference to an object.

blockquote.para: [!NOTE] With only a few exceptions, weak reference support is on by default for Windows Runtime types that you consume or author in C++/WinRT, WRL, and C++/CX. Windows.UI.Composition and Windows.Devices.Input.PenDevice are examples of exceptions—that is, namespaces where weak reference support is not on for those types.
If you're authoring types, then see Weak references in C++/WinRT.
